'''Treasure Hoarders''' can be encountered as enemies. They are typically found in [[Liyue]] and [[Inazuma]], although there is a small pocket of them in and around [[Dragonspine]].

==Types==
*{{Enemy|Treasure Hoarders: Scout}} &mdash; They primarily attack with throwing knives
*{{Enemy|Treasure Hoarders: Marksman}} &mdash; Scouts who use crossbows
*{{Enemy|Treasure Hoarders: Seaman}} &mdash; Armed with an oar
*{{Enemy|Treasure Hoarders: Handyman}} &mdash; Hand-to-hand combatants, they prefer kicks instead of punches
*{{Enemy|Treasure Hoarders: Crusher}} &mdash; Armed with a hammer
*{{Enemy|Treasure Hoarders: Gravedigger}} &mdash; Armed with a shovel, they dig up soil to impair vision
*{{Enemy|Treasure Hoarders: Pugilist}} &mdash; Hand-to-hand combatants

;Potioneers
Alchemists who brew concotions to deal Elemental damage.
*{{Enemy|Treasure Hoarders: Cryo Potioneer}}
*{{Enemy|Treasure Hoarders: Electro Potioneer}}
*{{Enemy|Treasure Hoarders: Hydro Potioneer}}
*{{Enemy|Treasure Hoarders: Pyro Potioneer}}

;Elites
High-ranking members serving as event or quest-exclusive fights.
*{{Enemy|Treasure Hoarders: Boss}} &mdash; The so-called female "Boss" who wields an axe
*{{Enemy|Treasure Hoarders: Carmen}} &mdash; Armed with a shovel for melee and ranged attacks
*{{Enemy|Treasure Hoarders: Liuliu}} &mdash; An expert arsonist, he uses a crossbow armed with flaming arrows and molotovs for {{Color|Pyro DMG}}
*{{Enemy|Treasure Hoarders: Wallenstein}} &mdash; This muscular Treasure Hoarder elite is armed with a hammer
